byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow.
byline.original: By STANLEY REED and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

abstract: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries says it is cutting oil production by about 4.5 percent, or 1.2 millions barrels a day, in 2017; anticipation of cut sends oil price to nearly $50 per barrel, about 8 percent increase; energy analysts say six-month deal with trivial production cut may reflect influence of Iran, which wants to increase production past its pre-sanctions levels.

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The deal will be the first production cut in eight years, although the price increase may prove temporary.
snippet: The deal will be the first production cut in eight years, although the price increase may prove temporary....

headline.main: OPEC Reaches Deal to Limit Production, Sending Prices Soaring
headline.print_headline: OPEC to Limit Production as Iran’s Influence Grows
